TextView.android:text: Xi'an Jiaotong University and the University of Liverpool signed agreement to set up XJTLU.
Ministry of Education approved the construction of XJTLU.
XJTLU enrolled more than 160 undergraduates for the first time.
More than 570 undergraduate students joined XJTLU’s second cohort.
Professor Youmin Xi, former vice president of Xi'an Jiaotong University, was appointed as the executive president of Xi'an Jiaotong Liverpool University.
Yuan Guiren, Chinese Minister of Education, visited XJTLU to check the teaching situation.
The first batch of undergraduates graduated from XJTLU– 97 percent of graduates continued their studies overseas.
XJTLU held the fifth anniversary celebration. The XJTLU Education Development Foundation was launched.
More than 2200 students enrolled in the seventh cohort at XJTLU.
Professor Sarah Dixon, former dean of the school of management at the University of Bradford, joined XJTLU and established International Business School Suzhou.
XJTLU held its first direct entry recruitment process.
Collaboration agreement was signed between XJTLU and Suzhou Industrial Park to create a world-class platform for innovation in Suzhou.
XJTLU officially celebrated its 10th anniversary and the new south campus was put into use.
The BSc Applied Chemistry programme received accreditation from the Royal Society of Chemistry, a first for a Sino-foreign University in China.
A cooperation agreement was signed by the China Development Bank, Suzhou Municipal People’s Government, and XJTLU to launch the XIPU New Era Development Research Institute.
Xi’an Jiaotong-Liverpool University’s new Entrepreneur College (Taicang) officially started construction .
